Title:
A new species of Wrightoporia (Wrightoporiaceae,
Basidiomycota) from Sri Lanka
Abstract:
A new resupinate polypore, Wrightoporia srilankensis sp.
nov., is described from Sri Lanka. It is characterized by perennial,
resupinate basidiocarps with buff-yellow pores, margin and subiculum
with rhizomorphs, a dimitic hyphal structure with yellowish crystals on
both generative and skeletal hyphae, generative hyphae bearing clamp
connections, dextrinoid and cyanophilous skeletal hyphae, the absence of
gloeoplerous hyphae and gloeocystidia, and broadly ellipsoid, hyaline,
thick-walled, finely asperulate, strongly amyloid, cyanophilous
basidiospore measuring as 3.84.2 × 2.83.2 µm. Molecular phylogenetic
analyses based on ITS and nLSU rDNA sequences confirmed that W.
srilankensis nested in Wrightoporia clade. W. srilankensis is closely
related to Wrightoporia avellanea which, however, lacks cystidioles, and
its hyphae are smooth (without crystals).
